## **Filtering Through a Very Crowded Field**

One of the main challenges in picking the best portable Bluetooth speaker
nowadays is the fact that there are so many available options. If you visit
the [Portable Bluetooth Speakers category](https://amzn.to/2XCB03R) on
Amazon.com you’ll find more than 2000 speakers to pick from! If you filter by
only those with a rating of 4.5 stars or higher, you still end up with more
than 1000. So, where do you start?

Don’t let its small size fool you, the sound produced by the OontZ Angle 3 is
absolutely remarkable for such a small speaker. The high-quality sound is more
than loud enough to fill a room without any distortion and the accompanying
bass is unbelievable.  

[ **Check Price**](https://www.amazon.com/dp/B073BVWRSP/?tag=outeraudio-20)

There are quite a few factors that you’ll have to take into consideration
before making your purchase. The intended use of the speaker will obviously
play a big role, for example, do you lead an active lifestyle and want to take
the speaker with you on sporting events or do you like chilling in the park
with friends and just want something funky to provide some background tunes.

## How did we pick these speakers?

We understand that everyone has their own unique set of features that they
value when considering a Bluetooth speaker. So what did we look at in
selecting speakers for this list and making our ultimate recommendation? Here
are some of the features we considered:

  * Sound Quality
  * Portability (more on that below)
  * Design Quality and Materials
  * Waterproof Ratings and Durability
  * Battery Life
  * Bluetooth Range and Connectivity
  * Value for Money

I wish I could tell you we then weighed each of these options scientifically
and mathematically but let’s face it, that weighting would be subjective in
itself, so we simply leaned on years of experience and hours of comparing, and
picked what we believed to be the best portable Bluetooth speakers on the
market today. We’ll keep on updating and changing this list as new speakers
are released, or whenwe change our minds!

## What does “Portable” mean?

I think we can all readily agree that a portable speaker should be capable of
being moved from one location to another. [Bookshelf
speakers](https://www.outeraudio.com/bookshelf-speakers/), or [in-
wall](https://www.outeraudio.com/in-wall-speakers/) and [in-ceiling
speakers](https://www.outeraudio.com/in-ceiling-speakers/) will obviously not
make the cut. The problem is that the literal definition of “portability” is
still too broad. There are some truly tiny Bluetooth speakers that could fit
in the palm of your hand, as well as PA systems or tailgate speakers that
require being wheeled around like airport luggage. They may be movable, but
for the purpose of this discussion, we’re not considering them as portable.
Here’s what we think:

**A portable speaker should fit in your hand, or in a backpack or at a
stretch, would have to go on the seat next to you in your car, but not in the
trunk!**

Besides making sure your speakers are actually portable, you’ll also want to
ensure that the speaker you buy has the right design, battery life, range,
audio quality and durability that you desire if you want to avoid
disappointment. And then there’s, of course, the price. For a more detailed
discussion of these considerations take. apeek at our Buyers Guide at. the end
of this article.

Taking the above-mentioned into consideration, here’s our list of the best
portable speakers with Bluetooth capabilities on the market.

Ahh, finally.

The JBL Flip 5 is the latest in a long line of beloved Bluetooth speakers
renowned for their quality sound and affordability. The JBL Flip 5 is the best
portable Bluetooth speaker for JBL fans who can’t get enough of their
proprietary sound signature, and want to take that sound profile on the go
with them. If you are on a camping trip, beach day, working outdoors, or
having a small get-together you can’t go wrong with the tried and true JBL
Flip series, but what’s new with the 5th iteration of the design?

Compared to the Flip 4, the JBL Flip 5 is slightly bigger. This was a decision
made by the engineers at JBL to provide the new Flip 5 with a larger battery
and a slightly bigger sound. The Flip 5 is still waterproof, still has a
speakerphone for taking calls, but comes with 4 more watts of output power.

Another change is that the Flip 5 is not compatible with Connect+ speakers,
rather the new Flip series speakers will use JBL’s PartyBoost connectivity for
chaining speakers together. The Flip 5 also comes in more color varieties and
charges via a USB-c port.

Like its predecessors, the JBL Flip 5 is a top competitor among portable
Bluetooth speakers, some may even call it the hands-down best portable speaker
out there. The speaker is fully waterproof, has punchy bass, it’s loud, and it
has a great new battery in it that is rated for 12 hours of life. At max
volume, you can still get at least 5 hours out of the Flip 5, which is amazing
for such a great price!

Overall, I’d say the Flip 5 totally lives up to the Flip family name.

There are key factors that people expect when they’re buying a portable
Bluetooth speaker, and the Flip 5 hits every checkbox for a better price than
a lot of the competition. The only two criticisms I have are the lack of a
3.5mm jack and 360 sound capability, but let’s cross our fingers for the Flip
6!

For the better part of a decade, JBL has been highly competitive in the
portable speaker market with the Flip series, and with the Flip 5, they’re
sure to stay on top for a while longer!

#### Why should you buy the JBL Flip 5?

  * Great Sound Signature
  * High-Quality Product
  * Color Options

This triangular speaker has been on our best portable Bluetooth speaker list
for quite some time, and it is not hard to see why. The OontZ Angle 3 provides
you with pretty much everything you could possibly need. The first thing you
will notice is that the speaker is pretty small and very light. It is about 5
inches long and no taller than 3 inches, with a weight of no more than 9
ounces, making it super portable. This allows you to easily carry it around or
simply put in your backpack or handbag.

Don’t let the small size fool you though, the sound that is produced by the
OontZ Angle 3 is absolutely remarkable for such a small speaker. The high-
quality sound is more than loud enough to fill a room without any distortion
and the accompanying bass is unbelievable. Cambridge SoundWorks claims that
the OontZ Angle 3 forms part of the next generation of portable speakers and
we have to agree because none of their competitors come close to what they
have achieved with this portable speaker.

As for some of the other aspects of the speaker; it is water-resistant with an
IPX5 rating which basically means that it is splash-proof, rainproof,
dustproof, and sand proof. You can also connect to the speaker via Bluetooth
from pretty much any suitable device, or you can use an AUX cable. Thanks to
the built-in mic, you also get the convenient hands-free feature which will
allow you to access your iPhone or Smartphone through voice commands.

It is hard to find anything bad to say about this particular portable speaker
since it truly does look great, feel great, and sound great – and best of all,
it is totally affordable.

#### Why should you buy the OontZ Angle 3?

  * Best Budget Option
  * Great Sound for Its Size
  * Very Portable

Bose lived up to their reputation when they launched the SoundLink Mini II. It

quite surprising as it is much deeper and more powerful than you would expect
from such a small portable speaker.

As for the style of the SoundLink Mini II, it is stylish and modern, with the

of an audiophile. It is available in Carbon and Pearl colors – which are
basically just black and white. However, we have to say that this speaker
looks absolutely amazing wherever you choose to use it. Its sleek design makes
it an attractive accessory for your home or office.

The SoundLink Mini II has a Lithium battery which gives you up to 10 hours of
play-time. This is where we see another cool feature of this speaker which is

Anker is a rather popular brand when it comes to portable Bluetooth speakers
and it is not hard to see why. They constantly release newer better speakers
that are available at affordable prices. With these high-quality speakers you
would almost expect there to be some kind of catch but that does not seem to
be the case. As far as we can see Anker just somehow continue to design
awesome speakers that they continue to sell at low prices and all the while
the company keeps expanding.

The first thing you want to know about any speaker is if the sound is good.
Take it from me; the Anker Soundcore 2 produced superior sound with little to
no distortion at even the highest volumes. While on the subject of volume, the
Soundcore 2 can go pretty loud despite its small and compact size. When you
first hear the speaker at full volume, you almost want to look around the room
to see if there is a larger more powerful speaker hiding somewhere that is
actually responsible for the sound.

The majority of speaker brands take the contemporary, minimalistic route when
designing their speakers. So, of course, Anker did the same. Give the people
what they want, right? The Anker Soundcore 2 does, in fact, have a very simple
design and I have to say I think that it looks great. The speaker is black
with a rectangular shape and has the Anker brand name printed on the grill in
a simple gray classic Anker font.

So now that we have established that the speaker looks great, the only thing
left to add is the fact that it is small and compact so it will easily fit
into your purse or backpack which is essential for a portable Bluetooth
speaker.

The Anker Soundcore 2 is a high-quality speaker that has managed to make
itself a worthy competitor by giving users a feature that some of the other
portable speakers lack, namely long battery life. The Anker Soundcore 2 gives
us almost twice as much battery life as some of the other portable speakers
with up to 24 hours of playtime.

Featuring an IPX7 rating, the Anker Soundcore 2 is protected against rain,
dust, and snow. Its build design features ergonomic controls, smooth clean
curves, and is available in 3 colors (black, blue, or red).

As for the sound, the speaker comprises of 2 x 6W drivers that emit powerful
bass results with full sound. The clarity and volume are equally impressive
even at its max Bluetooth connection range of 66ft.

For a small, high-quality contemporary speaker, with long battery life, the
Anker Soundcore 2 is a perfect choice. It is probably the best portable
Bluetooth speaker for those hunting for real value for money.

#### Why should you buy the Soundcore 2?

  * Great Value for Money
  * IPX 7 Waterproof
  * Good Sound Signature

The sequel to the beloved Bose SoundLink Color, the Bose SoundLink Color Color
II, draws on all of the features that made its first-generation iteration
great and re-contextualizes them in an attempt to make this device even more
robust and powerful than ever before. Coming in 6 different colors, the
SoundLink Color II is a no-frills competitor within our list of best portable
Bluetooth speakers that offers seamless hands-free call support, a soft-touch
silicone exterior, proprietary app support, and more.

Bose has a reputation for quality, and I think they’ve created yet another
solid product with the SoundLink Color II.

With the Bose SoundLink Color II, you can enjoy your favorite music or
podcasts with top-of-the-line audio quality from up to 30-feet away via
Bluetooth connectivity all from your mobile phone. The SoundLink Color’s
battery can deliver your sound continuously for 8 hours on a single charge and
pair with other Bose devices to play music from more than one area at once!

The SoundLink Color II sounds great, this is certainly one of the best compact
portable Bluetooth speakers I’ve listened to. The sound signature is as
neutral as any of Bose’s other speaker products. The same level of attention
to detail was paid to this speaker regarding the audio signal’s frequency
response. The bass sounds great even though the speaker is so small, but the
treble is present and tight. The speaker is deceptively loud for such a
compact speaker and peaks at 90dB, the same as the UE Boom 3, but lacking
360-degree sound capability.

A great and often overlooked feature included in the Bose SoundLink Color II’s
design is the inclusion of voice prompts that guide you through Bluetooth
pairing, so getting your devices set up with this speaker will be relatively
hassle-free.

The Bose SoundLink Color II covers many of the key features we look for when
determining where a speaker will be placed in a list such as this one. The
newest in the Bose SoundLink Color series of speakers is highly portable,
decently waterproof, and satisfying to use thanks to ease-of-use features and
the comfortable touch silicone enclosure surrounding the speaker.

Overall, the Bose SoundLink Color II is not the best portable Bluetooth
speaker Bose has put out yet. It’s extremely portable and has great, sound
quality, ease-of-use features, and color varieties. Special attention was
clearly given to making this speaker simple and easy to use so that us
listeners can get right back to listening to our favorite songs by the pool or
in our living rooms with friends!

The only unfortunate detail is that there are known issues with this speaker’s
battery life where the device eventually stops taking a charge, so be wary of
this before you buy. Still, even after considering the minor issue of battery
life with this speaker, it is a contender for the best portable Bluetooth
speaker.

#### Why should you buy the SoundLink Color II?

  * Quality Product
  * Trusted Brand
  * Great Sound Signature

### Durability

No matter how careful you are when using your portable Bluetooth speaker
outdoors accidents will inevitably happen. Durability should be an important
consideration for all portable speakers, but the more active your lifestyle
the biggest the influence this factor will be for you.

For the occasional hike or hanging out with friends at the beach, you might
still be able to get away with a speaker that is only water and maybe dust
resistant, but for the more adventurous souls, it’s a different matter.
Advantages such as being weatherproof and shock resistant become essential if
you spend a lot of time outdoors in bad weather or wet conditions. Sometimes
the extra durability comes with an inflated price tag, but you also get
products like the [Photive
Hydra](https://www.amazon.com/dp/B00K589F8A/?tag=outeraudio-20) that can take
a few knocks without your wallet having to get involved in the beating as
well.

### Size & Weight

![Pocket Sized Anker Wireless Bluetooth
Speaker](data:image/svg+xml;base64,PHN2ZyB2aWV3Qm94PSIwIDAgMzAwIDMwMCIgd2lkdGg9IjMwMCIgaGVpZ2h0PSIzMDAiIHhtbG5zPSJodHRwOi8vd3d3LnczLm9yZy8yMDAwL3N2ZyI+PC9zdmc+)

Even in the portable Bluetooth speaker market, you will find that there are
marketable size differences between different brands. Obviously, you want
something that is small enough to carry around and ideally fit in your pocket,
but not at the cost of inferior audio quality.

If you absolutely cannot live without thumping bass then you had better be
prepared to lug around a bit more weight with you as the smaller speakers tend
to be a bit lacking when it comes to the low-end of the audio spectrum.
Lightweight speakers can offer good sound quality as the Pocket-Sized Anker
Wireless Bluetooth Speaker have demonstrated, but compare it to something like
the Amazon Tap and you will hear the difference. If you don’t mind sacrificing
a bit of audio quality for the convenience of carrying a lighter load you’ll
find plenty of speakers, like those from Anker to choose from.

### Battery Life

About the only thing worse than carrying around a heavy portable speaker that
doesn’t sound that great is carrying around a heavy portable speaker with a
flat battery. If all you ever do is go for a walk in the park or lounge around
in the backyard by [the pool](https://www.outeraudio.com/best-waterproof-
floating-pool-speakers/) you can still get away with a portable speaker that
has a shorter battery life. Anything that takes you further from home, and
more importantly the battery charger is going to require a portable speaker
that can keep going for a while.

The companies that try and sell you these speakers often have very optimistic
estimates in their product descriptions and these don’t always match what you
will get in real-life. Be prepared to get a much shorter battery life than the
product description if you are prone to using your portable speaker at the top
volume all of the time. If extended camping trips in the wilderness are your
thing something like the Eton Rugged Rukus All-Terrain Portable Solar Wireless
Sound System which can be recharged with solar power might be the only
solution for you. Just bear in mind portable speakers are not of much use if
your actual audio playback device, be it a smartphone, tablet or laptop runs
out of juice so make sure you have something that can keep up with your
speaker.

### Sound Quality

Depending on how much of an audiophile you are, sound quality should be at the
top of your list when it comes to portable Bluetooth speakers. Let’s face it;
you are going to find speakers that sound like an AM radio station playing in
mono. This is why it is so important to test the speakers yourself or listen
to the good advice from reputable websites. Product reviews from other
consumers should also give you a good pretty good indication about the audio
quality, but bear in mind that tastes differ and something that sounds
horrible to one person might sound like a heavenly symphony to someone else.

Many portable speakers inevitably sacrifice some audio quality in order to
pack all those components into a portable casing, but this doesn’t mean you
have to settle for something that sounds like a payphone during playback. For
the best sound quality, especially when it comes to bass you might have to dig
a little deeper into your wallet and prepare yourself for some extra weight,
but in the end, it is worth it.

### Extras

If all you want is a piece of plastic that plays music and doesn’t really care
for much else you can probably overlook the extras. More discerning buyers, on
the other hand, will want to get as much value for money when it comes to
their portable Bluetooth speakers. If you are the outdoors type that prefers
to move around by means other than your own two legs you might want a speaker
that can be clipped to the handlebars of your bike or backpack. Some speakers
offer this feature as standard while others require a separate purchase for
accessories.

For example, the Pyle PWPBT60 Sound Box Splash has an integrated metal loop to
hang it off anything, while if customization is your thing, you might like the
Bose SoundLink Mini Bluetooth Speaker II with their soft covers or something
from Jawbone that can be upgraded with new features or apps.

The types of ports and jacks included on the speaker are also quite important
unless you plan on sticking exclusively to Bluetooth usage. Some portable
speakers include microphones so you can answer your phone via the speaker
while others forego this option. Don’t pay through your nose for extras that
you will never use, but don’t compromise on a speaker that can’t offer you
everything you want either.

### Range

The final thing to consider when it comes to portable Bluetooth speakers is
the range. Obviously, you are not going to leave your expensive speaker in the
middle of nowhere and go wandering around, but neither do you want something
that has to be tethered to your phone in order to work correctly. The ideal
portable speaker will give you some breathing room to move about without
losing the connection. The further the range of the speaker the better, but
there’s no need to go overboard and pay extra for a speaker that can continue
playing even when you are too far away to hear it.
